dimensions.notes: 16 = diameter in mm, 34 = height in mm, 0 = cylindrical

protection.unprotected: No built-in protection - requires external BMS

cr123a_compatibility.compatibility_warning: NOT directly interchangeable due to voltage difference
cr123a_compatibility.device_approval_required: Only use if device explicitly supports 16340/RCR123A
cr123a_compatibility.risk: Higher voltage may damage devices designed for 3V CR123A

safety_notes: Use appropriate li-ion charger with CC/CV profile
Avoid physical damage - can cause thermal runaway
Store at 40-60% charge for long term storage
Protected cells recommended for most applications
Do not use in devices designed only for 3V CR123A
Monitor temperature during charging and discharge

chemistry_variants.lco: Lithium Cobalt Oxide - Higher energy density, requires more careful handling
chemistry_variants.lmo: Lithium Manganese Oxide - Better thermal stability
chemistry_variants.nmc: Lithium Nickel Manganese Cobalt - Balanced performance

performance_characteristics.memory_effect: None - can be charged at any state

notes: Rechargeable lithium-ion equivalent to CR123A primary batteries, but with higher nominal voltage (3.7V vs 3.0V). Popular in high-drain devices like tactical flashlights. The '16340' designation comes from dimensions: 16mm diameter × 34mm height. Protected versions with built-in safety circuits are strongly recommended for consumer use.

cross_references.cr123a_comparison: Rechargeable version but higher voltage - not always compatible
cross_references.18650_comparison: Smaller capacity and size than 18650 batteries
cross_references.14500_comparison: Similar concept but different size (AA-sized vs CR123A-sized)
